intro: Sisymbrium lechleri, commonly known as the Andean oriole plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. It is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Sisymbrium lechleri is also noted for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in local herbal medicine.
